Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Stern, S.A., D.C. Slater, J. Scherrer, J. Stone, M. Versteeg, M.F. A'Hearn, J.L. Bertaux, P.D. Feldman, M.C. Festou, J.W. Parker, and O.H.W. Siegmund, Alice: The Rosetta Ultraviolet Imaging Spectrograph, Space Sci. Rev., 128(1-4), 507-527, Feb 2007.

Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Stern, S. A., et al., ROSETTA-ORBITER CAL/EARTH ALICE 3 EAR3 V1.0 RO-CAL/E-ALICE-3-EAR3-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 2010.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: Calibrated instrument data from the Rosetta Orbiter ALICE instrument during the EAR3 mission phase
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set contains CODMAC level 3 data acquired by the Rosetta Orbiter ALICE UV Spectrometer during the third earth flyby mission phase, which took place between 2009-09-14 and 2009-12-13.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Required Reading ================
The format of all Alice data are described in detail by the EAICD document located in the /DOCUMENT directory. In addition, the Rosetta Alice logbook file, RA_LOGBOOK_NNN.ASC, also located in the DOCUMENT directory provides observational details such as observation target, commanded exposure time, etc., for all Alice data. The Alice team strongly recommends reading this documentation before using the data.
Data Set Overview =================
This data set contains calibrated data acquired by the Rosetta Orbiter ALICE UV Spectrometer during the Earth Swing-by 3 mission phase, which took place between 2009-09-14 and 2009-12-13. It also includes data from Payload Checkout 10. A detailed listing of all Alice observations is given in the observation log file located in the DOCUMENT directory.
The following Alice observations were made during the period covered by this data set:
# # Payload Checkout #10 (PC10) # 2009 September 18 - October 8 # Alice activity overview: # * 2009 Sep 18 02:15 - AL01 (passive checkout; 2 hr) # * 2009 Sep 18 04:00 - AL02A (initial decontamination; 25 hr, 22hr heater + 3hr cooldown) # * 2009 Sep 19 05:45 - Alice interference test repeat with MIRO, OSIRIS, VIRTIS (15 min) # * 2009 Sep 19 06:25 - AL04 (HV/Discriminator test [alf Gru]; 22hr 40min) # * 2009 Sep 20 05:10 - AL03B (Cal Star, Narrow Center [alf Gru]; 1 hr) # * 2009 Sep 20 07:30 - AL11 (Stellar Flat field Scan [alf Gru]; 5 hr 25 min) # * 2009 Sep 20 14:50 - AL99A (flight software patch, v2.07; 45 min) # * 2009 Sep 24 10:00 - GO/NOGO for remaining Alice operations based on results of AL99A patch # * 2009 Sep 25 23:55 - AL99B (validation test of flight software patch, v2.07; 2hr) # * 2009 Sep 26 02:10 - AL03A (Cal Star, Narrow Center [Vega]; 1hr) # * 2009 Sep 26 05:05 - AL06B, AL08B (Cal Star, Wide Bottom & Top [alf Gru]; 2 hr 10 min) # * 2009 Sep 26 07:10 - AL09A/B/C (Alignment with OSIRIS [alf Gru]; 4 hr 15 min) # * 2009 Sep 26 12:25 - AL03D/E/F/G (Deadtime cal [zet Cas, HD 57682, BD +28 4211, G191 B2B, eta Uma]; 8 hr 25 min) # * 2009 Sep 27 22:45 - AL03H (Cal star & Deadtime Check [eps Ori]; 30 min) # * 2009 Sep 29 06:15 - AL10D/E/I (Perpetual Pixel List cal [HD 57682, BD +28 4211, 10 Lac]; 2 hr 23 min) # * 2009 Sep 30 02:25 - AL07 (darks; 3 hr) # * 2009 Sep 30 05:25 - AL02B (final decontamination; 25 hr, 22hr heater + 3hr cooldown)
# # Earth Swingby #3 (ESB3) # 2009 November 06 - 19 # Alice activity overview: # * 2009 Nov 06, 22:00 - AL01: Passive Checkout (2 hr) without door performance test # * 2009 Nov 07, 00:00 - AL02A: Decontamination (25 hr) # * 2009 Nov 08, 01:10 - AL10: Darks (2hr) # * 2009 Nov 08, 03:10 - AL11A: Boresight determination of the remote sensing instruments (4 hr) # * 2009 Nov 10, 18:30 - AL03A: stellar cal; alp Gru (1 hr) # * 2009 Nov 10, 20:30 - AL03B: stellar cal; Vega (1 hr) # * 2009 Nov 11, 22:30 - AL12: Ride along with OSIRIS Earth observations (24 hr) # * 2009 Nov 13, 01:25 - AL13: Ride along with OSIRIS Earth observations and HEET data (5 hr 40 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 07:15 - AL20: HEET mode (45 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 07:45 - Earth closest approach # * 2009 Nov 13, 08:00 - AL06 : Earth calibrations, ride alongs, and HEET data (3 hr 10 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 11:15 - AL10B and AL10C: Darks (4 hr) # * 2009 Nov 13, 15:25 - AL41: Moon occultation of rho Lup (30 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 15:40 - Moon closest approach # * 2009 Nov 13, 15:55 - AL14 : Ride along with VIRTIS Moon night side observation (30 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 16:35 - AL40 : Baseline spectra of rho Lup (30 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 17:20 - AL07 : Calibration on Moon's illuminated limb and ridealong with OSIRIS raster (4 hr 36 mn) # * 2009 Nov 13, 22:05 - AL08 : Moon scans for flat field calibration (24 hr 20 mn) # * 2009 Nov 15, 22:00 - AL09 : Moon calibration as point source (10 hr) # * 2009 Nov 18, 06:00 - AL11B: Boresight determination of the remote sensing instruments (4 hr) # * 2009 Nov 18, 10:03 - AL02A: Decontamination (25 hr)
Processing ==========
The data in this data set are calibrated, CODMAC Level 3 data. As such, corrections for detector dead time, dark counts, flatfield, and effective area have generally been applied. The primary FITS header contains a list of which corrections have been applied to that file. See the CALIBRATION_COOKBOOK.PDF in the DOCUMENT directory for more information.
Data ====
The data are in FITS format and text format. Each FITS file has a detached PDS label so that they can be read either by FITS or PDS tools. A detailed description of the data format is given in the ALICE EAICD document located in the DOCUMENT directory of this data set.
Ancillary Data ============== No ancillary data included in this data set.
Coordinate System =================
The geometry items SC_SUN_POSITION_VECTOR, SC_TARGET_POSITION_VECTOR and SC_TARGET_VELOCITY_VECTOR provided in the label of the data product are relative to the Earth Mean Equator frame of J2000.
SUB_SPACECRAFT_LATITUDE, SUB_SPACECRAFT_LONGITUDE are given in the PLANETOGRAPHIC coordinate system. These parameters are computed at time t=START_TIME. Distances are given in km, angles in degrees.
Software ======== All FITS readers should be able to successfully read the data.
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note:
Confidence Level Overview =========================
Data confidence is nominal, meaning that all data have been validated by the Alice team and found as expected. Any exceptions are noted by the DATA_QUALITY field in the label files.
Review =====
Data Coverage and Quality =========================
Data quality is good unless otherwise noted by the DATA_QUALITY keyword.
Limitations ===========
Although these data have been calibrated and are in physical units, the wavelength scale is unique to each individial file. Thus, care must be taken when comparing one data file to another. The Alice team recommends using the reformatted, calibrated CODMAC level 4 data products, which solves this problem.
